Description: Apple Inc. reported a net income of $100 billion for the fiscal year 2023, driven by strong iPhone and Mac sales.
Goldman Sachs reported total revenue of $50 billion in 2023, with significant contributions from investment banking and trading divisions.
NextEra Energy achieved a net profit of $15 billion in 2023, primarily due to its renewable energy projects and increased electricity demand.
Pfizer reported a revenue of $90 billion in 2023, largely attributed to its COVID-19 vaccine sales and strong pharmaceutical product pipeline.
Nestlé recorded a net profit of $12 billion in 2023, with growth in its beverage and confectionery segments.
Toyota reported an operating income of $30 billion in 2023, benefiting from increased vehicle sales and cost-cutting measures.
Microsoft reported a net income of $70 billion for the fiscal year 2023, driven by its cloud services and software sales.
Qualcomm reported total revenue of $35 billion in 2023, with significant growth in its semiconductor and wireless technology segments.
Rio Tinto achieved a net profit of $20 billion in 2023, largely due to strong demand for iron ore and other minerals.
Walmart reported total revenue of $600 billion in 2023, with growth in both its physical stores and e-commerce platforms.
DHL reported an operating income of $5 billion in 2023, benefiting from increased demand for logistics and transportation services.
CBRE Group recorded a net profit of $2 billion in 2023, driven by growth in commercial real estate services and property management.
HCA Healthcare reported a revenue of $60 billion in 2023, with strong performance in its hospital and outpatient services.
Nike reported a net income of $10 billion for the fiscal year 2023, driven by strong sales in its footwear and apparel segments.
Netflix reported total revenue of $35 billion in 2023, with significant growth in its subscriber base and original content production.
